main event: An unidentified flying object was observed circling a mountain at about 1,000 feet elevation near Heber City, Utah on May 16, 1964.
interesting points: The object was navy grey in color and appeared to be shaped like a box-car with glowing edges., The object emitted a sound similar to a jet engine starting., It moved in a circular motion before rising to 1,500 feet and disappearing over a mountain., A witness reported that there were no known experimental aircraft or missile launches in the area at the time of the sighting., The official evaluation of the sighting concluded insufficient data for evaluation.
witness description: Mr. Linsey Crook, employed as a Wasatch Observer
